info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL MONTOUR... SOUTHEASTERN LYCOMING AND NORTHERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 709 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northwest of Bloomsburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Berwick, Hughesville, Mifflinville, Lightstreet, Jerseytown, Rohrsburg, Iola, Eyers Grove, Waller, Lairdsville, Exchange, Fairmount Spgs, Biggertown, Millville, Benton, Briar Creek, Orangeville and Stillwater. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
